newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks indicated higher on Wednesday.
newsitem.headline: French stocks indicated higher on Wednesday.

text.p: French shares were indicated higher on Wednesday, building on Tuesday's solid gain.

A statement on Tuesday night by French President Jacques Chirac left French markets unmoved and the stock market appeared relatively free of worries linked to a possible win by the left in Sunday's parliamentary runoff.
In pre-session electronic trading, blue-chip CAC-40 May futures were up 11 at 2,689.00 compared to an afterhours session settle price of 2,678.00 on Tuesday.
On Tuesday, the stock market gained 0.96 percent after serious foreign selling failed to materialise.
Gains in the dollar and bond prices were also expected to help the bourse on Wednesday.
U.S. durable goods orders for April due at 1230 GMT.
* LVMH, which opposes the planned Guinness-Grand Met merger, says it will exercise its rights to repurchase Guinness's interests in their existing joint ventures.
It says it still holds open its proposal that Guinness-Grand Met split the brewing and spirits businesses and create the world's leading spirits group with LVMH.
